screen_desc: This screenshot shows the "Settings" page of a mobile device. It provides options for managing network & internet connections, connected devices, battery, display settings, sound, storage, privacy, location, security, and accounts. The layout is organized by categories with related settings listed underneath each. The search bar at the top allows quick access to specific settings. The battery status is also displayed at the top, showing it is fully charged (100%).
action_think: To uninstall the 'Walmart Shopping & Grocery' app, I need to navigate through the settings to the 'Apps & notifications' section. From there, I can access the list of apps and proceed to uninstall the specified app.
action_plan: Tap on 'Apps & notifications' to proceed to the app management section.
Find 'Walmart Shopping & Grocery' in the list of apps.
Tap on the app and select 'Uninstall' to remove it.
action_desc: Tap on 'Apps & notifications' to access the app management settings.
action_result: By pressing the home button, I have exited the settings menu and returned to the home screen of the mobile phone. This action has neither progressed nor regressed the task of uninstalling the "Walmart Shopping & Grocery" app. To proceed with the user request, the next step would be to locate the app in the phone's app drawer or on the home screen, then long-press on the app to find the uninstall option, or go to the settings menu to the apps section and find "Walmart Shopping & Grocery" in the list of installed apps to uninstall it.
